BALAJI MADDIPATI  | balajimaddipati@yahoo.com | +1(201) 744 5996

Summary: 
• Over 10 years of experience in software design and development across multiple 
domains, with significant expertise as a Dell Boomi developer. Proficient in 
designing, implementing, and optimizing complex integration processes using Dell 
Boomi. 
• Proficient in Java development, specializing in building scalable, high-performance 
applications. Extensive experience with Java 8, Spring Boot, and microservices 
architecture. 
• Expertise in developing end-to-end integrations, including RESTful web services, 
API integration, and large-scale distributed systems. Well-versed in React, NodeJS, 
Groovy Script, and various APIs. 
• Detailed configuration of Dell Boomi Atom Clouds, local Atoms, and Molecules 
enabling landscapes for the proposed architecture for integration processes.

Groovy Script, and various APIs. 
• Detailed configuration of Dell Boomi Atom Clouds, local Atoms, and Molecules 
enabling landscapes for the proposed architecture for integration processes. 
• Experience in developing interfaces integrating Employee Central data with third-
party Payroll systems using SFAPI and ODATA API objects. 
• Proficient with Dell Boomi connectors, including Success Factors, Disk, FTP, Mail, 
Salesforce, Web Services listener, HTTP client, Web Services SOAP, REST clients, 
and SFTP. 
• Familiarity with other Dell Boomi Connectors such as Atom Sphere API and Atom 
Queues. 
• Worked with different data formats, including Flat file, XML, and JSON, as well as 
database systems. 
• Developed processes as per requirements using various connectors, including set 
properties, Decision shape, Branch, Try/catch shape, Data Process, Document 
cache, and return document. 
• In-depth knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), particularly

properties, Decision shape, Branch, Try/catch shape, Data Process, Document 
cache, and return document. 
• In-depth knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), particularly 
within Agile methodologies (Scrum and Kanban). Actively involved in system 
analysis, design, and development of web applications. 
• Strong database skills with experience in PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Oracle, and MS 
SQL, including writing SQL scripts, procedures, and triggers. 
• Demonstrated ability to lead projects through all stages of development, from 
requirements gathering and design to deployment and maintenance. 
• Committed to utilizing skills to further the mission of a company. Proven ability to 
establish and maintain excellent communication and relationships with clients. 
• Extensive experience in Java frameworks, including Spring Boot, Hibernate, and 
RESTful API development. Skilled in developing secure, high-performance 
applications. 
 
Technical skills:

J2EE Technologies Servlets, JSP, JDBC, JSF, Web Services 
Frameworks Spring, Hibernate, JUnit 
IDE Tools Eclipse, NetBeans 
Application/Webserver & Services IBM WebSphere, JBoss, Tomcat, WebLogic

Databases Oracle, DB2, SQL Server, MongoDB

JavaBeans, Collections

JavaScript

Build/Deploy Tools ANT, Maven, Gradle, Bamboo, Jenkins

Role: Dell Boomi Developer       JAN 2019 - CURRENT 
Client: FLORIDA BLUE, USA 
Project: Boomi Platform Management and Integration Portal 
Boomi AtomSphere Integration Platform as a Service (iPaaS) enables customers to 
integrate any combination of cloud and on-premise applications without the need 
for additional software, applications, or coding. 
The Integration Portal is accessible by internal users at Florida Blue and also helps 
organizations meet the security and integration needs of digital business through a single 
multi-channel gateway. 
Responsibilities: 
• Involved in requirements gathering with multiple project managers to customize and 
utilize the full functionality of Salesforce. 
• Configured data models, including corporate and country-specific data models, and 
managed picklists in foundation objects (FO). Created and identified associations 
within the corporate data model.

managed picklists in foundation objects (FO). Created and identified associations 
within the corporate data model. 
• Designed and developed integrations for routing business exceptions to the new 
queue in Dell Boomi.

• Collaborated with other Boomi developers and cross-functional teams to understand 
business requirements and design processes in Boomi. 
• Configured document properties, dynamic document properties, process properties, 
dynamic  process  properties,  and  data  processes  to  split,  combine,  and  unzip 
documents.  Implemented  business  rules  and  alert  notifications  using  the  Mail 
connector, executed processes, and deployed them across all environments. 
• Managed, monitored, troubleshooted, and supported existing integrations, providing 
technical subject matter expertise. Implemented encryption and security protocols. 
• Designed,  developed,  deployed,  and  maintained  integration  processes  between 
applications across the cloud and/or on-premises using the Dell Boomi AtomSphere 
platform (cloud integration, application integration, and enterprise web service APIs). 
• Configured, developed, and maintained Boomi Master Data Hub (MDH/MDM) for

platform (cloud integration, application integration, and enterprise web service APIs). 
• Configured, developed, and maintained Boomi Master Data Hub (MDH/MDM) for 
Boomi  Integration,  including  data  quality  rules,  managing  golden  records,  and 
performing data stewardship. 
• Worked on an Agile (Scrum) development team to deliver regular updates to the 
business. 
• Developed and implemented integration solutions using Boomi for seamless data 
exchange between SAP and non-SAP systems, enhancing operational efficiency. 
• Configured and managed SAP connectors in Boomi to facilitate real-time data 
synchronization and process automation. 
• Successfully integrated MOVEit MFT with enterprise applications such as ERP, CRM, 
and data warehouses, enhancing data interoperability and streamlining business pro
cesses. 
• Leveraged MOVEit’s encryption and access control features to protect sensitive data 
during transit and at rest, reducing security incidents by 40%.

cesses.

• Strong knowledge of advanced java features like functional  interfaces,  lambdas, 
collections, and multi-threading.  
• Integrated Spring Security for authentication and authorization, improving application 
security.

• Integrated databases with Boomi and wrote SQL queries.

Project: API Connect

Role: Full Stack Developer      SEP 2017 – DEC 2018 
Client: FLORIDA BLUE         
Project: API Connect  
API Connect Cloud is made up of a cluster of servers interacting with other services 
offered in an enterprise, such as user directories and email servers, to carry out its 
operations. The Developer Portal provides a customizable self-service web-based portal for 
application developers to explore, discover, and subscribe to APIs. The developer portal acts 
as a marketplace and is the place where API consumers interact and collaborate with API 
providers. 
Responsibilities: 
• Worked in a highly dynamic Agile environment and participated in Scrum and sprint 
meetings. 
• Designed, analyzed, and developed the front-end and back-end Servlets, using 
Bootstrap for design, HTML5, CSS3, Ajax, and React JS for developing the 
presentation layer.

meetings.

presentation layer. 
• Developed RESTful web services for integrating with authentication services to 
retrieve user-related data and create tenant lookup services.

• Created custom components and widgets utilizing React.js to address global browser 
compatibility compliance needs. 
• Worked on creating responsive UI using React and Redux. 
• Used the React Grid Framework to create various grid layouts for UI with the 
concept of lazy loading. 
• Migrated business-critical Java-based solutions to the Node.js stack. 
• Worked in a Scrum Agile process with two-week iterations, delivering new features 
and working software at each iteration. 
• Worked extensively on the frontend, developing and updating pages using UI 
libraries like React JS (including Hooks) and Redux. 
• Participated in Sprint reviews and planning sessions with business analysts and team 
members to analyze business IT requirements and help the team achieve Sprint 
goals. 
• Designed and developed WebUI using JSP, Servlets, HTML, and jQuery. 
• Worked closely with the UX team to meet various standards and develop HTML 5 
prototypes.

as MongoDB and Redis. 
• Created UDFs (User Defined Functions) to fetch static data based on environments. 
• Integrated and configured Splunk with Spring Boot microservices on OpenShift for 
logging data. 
• Designed and developed a plethora of React.js components to manipulate the 
virtual DOM and render UI output based on business needs. 
• Integrated SonarQube with Jenkins for continuous inspection of code quality and 
analysis. 
• Experienced working with and writing Swagger and RAML definitions. 
• Used Log4J and Splunk for logging and tracing messages.

Role: Java J2EE Developer      SEP 2016 – AUG 2017  
Client: FLORIDA BLUE           
Project: Product Management Tool (PMT) 
 The Product Management Tool (PMT) is a new database and platform designed to 
consolidate all product and benefits information related to health, pharmacy, dental, and life 
products. This project serves as a single source of truth for both standard and group-specific 
plans and benefits. PMT provides comprehensive summaries and detailed information about 
products  and  benefits,  including  procedure  and  diagnosis  code  descriptions  for 
services. Ultimately, PMT will integrate with downstream systems and processes to support 
sales, Enrollment, claims adjudication, eligibility, and benefit requests, as well as self-service 
and assisted service.

Responsibilities: 
• Serving as a developer on projects to design, develop, test, document, and deploy 
robust integration solutions on the Dell Boomi AtomSphere Platform. 
• Managing, monitoring, troubleshooting, and supporting existing integrations while 
providing technical subject matter expertise. Implementing encryption and security 
protocols. 
• Designing, developing, deploying, and maintaining integration processes between 
applications across the cloud and/or on-premises using the Dell Boomi AtomSphere 
platform (including cloud integration, application integration, and enterprise web 
service APIs). 
• Configuring, developing, and maintaining Boomi Master Data Hub (MDH/MDM) for 
Boomi Integration. This involves using data quality rules, managing golden records, 
and performing data stewardship. 
• Collaborating with an Agile (Scrum) development team to deliver regular updates 
to the business.

Processes using different connectors and logic shapes between application profiles

• Creating EDI profiles (such as EDI-834 Benefit Enrolment and EDI-850 Purchase

• Adhering to HIPAA regulations and handling EDI transactions related to the 
healthcare domain (e.g., 270, 271, 837, 835) along with ICD-9/ICD-10 standards. 
• Developing Atoms/Molecules on Dev/Test/Prod servers, monitoring job processes, 
reporting screens, real-time dashboards, and account dashboards for errors and 
daily transaction counts. 
• Leveraging the Atmosphere API to automate the process of generating status

reporting screens, real-time dashboards, and account dashboards for errors and 
daily transaction counts. 
• Leveraging the Atmosphere API to automate the process of generating status 
reports for multiple Boomi environments. Also, automating testing procedures for 
Dell Boomi processes during monthly releases and other product updates. 
• Demonstrating strong proficiency in JavaScript, including DOM manipulation and 
understanding the JavaScript object model.

• Implementing the application using the Spring MVC Framework, including 
implementing controller and service classes. 
• Automating repeatable tasks to optimize time and effort during interface 
development and migration. 
• Creating REST APIs with Express, Node, and PostgreSQL to perform data operations 
from the UI. 
• Using AXIOS for API operations (GET, POST, DELETE). 
• Playing a major role in stabilizing React components and stand-alone functions for 
future pages. 
 
Role: Java Developer       AUG 2015 – AUG 2016 
Client: WELLS FARGO & CO      
Project: Records and Information Management Archive (RIMA) 
The Records and Information Management Archive Web Front End (RIMA WFE) is a 
web-based tool that grants access to the RIMA archive. It assists users in effectively 
managing electronic records and information, ensuring compliance with the Records 
Management Policy. 
Responsibilities:

managing electronic records and information, ensuring compliance with the Records 
Management Policy. 
Responsibilities: 
• Participating in the design, development, testing, and implementation phases of the 
Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC). 
• Creating a Detailed Design Document. 
• Estimating hardware requirements, including Documentum product suites and 
storage sizing. 
• Designing and developing application components using the Spring and Hibernate 
frameworks. 
• Working with the JWS API, which provides complete Exchange Web Services 
functionalities such as creating, deleting, updating, and restoring email items. 
• Designing database tables using named queries and adhering to database rules. 
• Contributing to the development of the user interface, which is built with the 
AngularJS framework. 
• Leveraging Spring Dependency Injection to load beans from configuration files. 
• Applying core Java concepts, including multithreading and collections, in the 
business layer.

• Leveraging Spring Dependency Injection to load beans from configuration files.

using SQL and Hibernate named queries. 
• Implementing a CI/CD pipeline involving Jenkins for complete automation from 
commit to deployment. 
• Writing SQL queries for inserting and updating the database. 
• Designing, developing, and implementing custom RESTful web services. 
• Creating Unix Shell Scripts to automate backend jobs and load data into the database 
using SQL Loader. 
• Assessing and identifying mitigation strategies for risks related to high-level design, 
integration, and data quality.

• Taking responsibility for the development of specific stories defined in Agile Sprints. 
• Conducting Sprint Retrospective meetings for the project. 
• Fixing defects and providing support for System Integration Testing and User 
Acceptance Testing. 
• Maintaining applications and handling technical change requests according to the 
Release Management process. 
• Participating in code reviews and preparing review notes for team members. 
• Focusing on day-to-day efforts to drive the actual coding development of solutions 
that meet defined specifications. 
• Working in an agile and Scrum environment, actively participating in daily Scrum 
meetings. 
Role: Software Developer      AUG 2013 –AUG 2014 
Client: SPENCER’S TECHNOLOGIES, HYDERABAD, INDIA   
 
Project: Spencer’s Treasury Services: 
 
Spencer’s Treasury Services provides cash management, trade, liquidity, commercial 
card, and escrow services to address the working capital and efficiency challenges faced by

Spencer’s Treasury Services provides cash management, trade, liquidity, commercial 
card, and escrow services to address the working capital and efficiency challenges faced by 
treasury professionals today. This project involves a cash management service delivered 
through a secure and authentic online system, including features such as money transfers 
between accounts.  
 
Responsibilities: 
• Conducted requirements analysis, gathering business requirements from end-users 
and Business Analysts. 
• Developed and deployed server-side Java, Servlets, and Java Server Pages (JSPs) for 
browser-based conference software. 
• Created EJB (Session Bean) components and deployed them on JBoss Application 
Server using the Eclipse Editor. 
• Designed JSP pages to support custom User Interfaces, utilizing JSTL tag libraries. 
• Leveraged core Java concepts extensively, including Multithreading, Collections 
Framework, File I/O, and Concurrency.

• Leveraged core Java concepts extensively, including Multithreading, Collections 
Framework, File I/O, and Concurrency. 
• Participated in developing SOA Web Services using XML, XPATH, XSD, SOAP, WSDL, 
and Apache Axis. 
• Developed SQL stored procedures and prepared statements for data updates and 
access from the database. 
• Implemented various J2EE Design patterns, such as Singleton, Service Locator, 
Business Delegate, Transfer Object, and LDAP Security in the application server. 
• Conducted SQL performance analysis on Oracle 10g database tables and improved 
performance through SQL tuning. 
• Utilized Log4j for logging mechanisms and developed wrapper classes to configure 
logs. 
• Employed JUnit and test cases for thorough testing of application modules.
